channel.title: Unlimited Detail
channel.description:
Have you guys checked this out yet?
[url='https://www.popsci.com/technology/article/2010-04/video-new-graphics-tech-promises-unlimited-graphics-power-without-extra-processing']https://www.popsci.com/technology/article/2010-04/video-new-graphics-tech-promises-unlimited-graphics-power-without-extra-processing[/url]
The tech seems pretty legitimate ... I don't know why, but I'm not that skeptical about it. With the proper funding and resources (which they seem to lack at the moment) this could very well be the future of graphics technology.
What do you think?

item.title: Unlimited Detail
item.dc:creator: Keresh
item.description:
calhoun freeman:

God, the interviewer voice is obnoxious.

Interviewees, more like.

Read full topic

item.title: Unlimited Detail
item.dc:creator: Hyperbyte
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

For the most part this video isn’t even about tech its just rambling about prettiness

That’s my biggest problem with it I think. All the time the interviewer was questioning him on behalf of others, and all the time the guy said “no, it really works, and it looks pretty” and that was it. Still, you know, I guess they want a chance to prove their ideas really work, before they explain how it works.

It’ll be interesting to see what happens after their public hiatus.

Read full topic

item.title: Unlimited Detail
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
I’m going to go ahead and blatantly state things any dumbass could notice.

  • Who the fuck is this interviewer? Why not choose a more reputable interviewer?

  • They never dismissed voxeloctrees

  • They admitted it was voxels

  • Why show old tech? Who does that?

  • For the most part this video isn’t even about tech its just rambling about prettiness

  • John and Notch’s statements don’t conflict. Because just because something won’t work yet doesn’t mean a lot of people aren’t fiddling with it.

  • The interview does not know when to shut the fuck up

Ultimately this video changed nothing about anyone’s knowledge of the system

Read full topic

item.title: Unlimited Detail
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
King_Kaddo:

3 Gtx 580s render this beauty in real time

There is no need for a technology like unlimited detail. It has no practical use in the gaming industry.

But even that was a relatively small scene with only about 5 or six visible buildings with not too many characters.

I hear that they’re working with the makers of Prototype to make an IP out of that demo though, they wouldn’t put that much work into something so insignificant. So I’m sure kinks will be worked out.

Read full topic

item.title: Unlimited Detail
item.dc:creator: Jeannotvb
item.description:
King_Kaddo:

3 Gtx 580s render this beauty in real time

There is no need for a technology like unlimited detail. It has no practical use in the gaming industry.

Equally impressive are their foliage demos that came with their UDK package. I posted a screenshot of one of the rocks from that map earlier in the thread. To think they did all that with a fairly modest increase in geometry detail and texture resolution… Imagine what the future will hold, I’d probably no longer have to worry about tricounts and texture resolution because I’m pretty sure that within 10 years the GPU will have massive amounts of memory available. The future will probably focus most on better lighting, shading, animation, post-processing and so on. The Unreal Engine 3 and the Cry Engine 3 are good examples of this.

Read full topic

item.title: Unlimited Detail
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
vand3537:

relative to expectations I guess, I still remember the first 3D shooters blowing my FUCKING MIND! :aah:

The first time I played Metal Gear Solid 2, I thought, “This looks frickin amazing”, followed soon after by, “How can graphics get any better than this?”

item.title: Unlimited Detail
item.dc:creator: vand3537
item.description:
mankyman6:

If you were to really look at a game’s environment, then you would notice how unrealistic almost all of them look.

relative to expectations I guess, I still remember the first 3D shooters blowing my FUCKING MIND! :aah:

still, I would trade this unlimited detail technology for good story/writing/atmosphere/plot in a heartbeat, those continue to decline about as fast as graphics improve

item.title: Unlimited Detail
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
Kairouseki:

Well just like how making games with polygons improved along with the hardware to display it this’ll take time to match what we have now.

I was referring to polygons. Take a look around any game you play and you’ll notice how unrealistic it really is.

One thing I notice, too many things are shiny.
